A River Runs Through It is based on the true story of two fly fishing brothers, Norman and Paul, (Brad Pitt and Craig Sheffer) whose Reverend father ( Tom Skerritt ) tries to teach them life’s lessons. Spanning about twenty-five years, the film chronicles Norman and Paul’s tumultuous lives - with Norman as a constant force; attempting to save his wild child little brother from his own wild self.

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made..... Realistic. Movies were not candy coated during the late 60s and early 70s. Violence, swearing etc was not the norm because of simple morality because of religious views and or SCP thought. Pierce Brosnan has sipped his last Martini and returns, in an outrageous self-parody, as the aging foul-mouthed boozy assassin Julian — a successor to James Bond — with one foot in the grave. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: "Early Years" and "Adult Years". While giving the necessary background information about the complicated, poignant life of the author, it also portrays the struggle against ruling Japanese government which strongly influenced the political orientation of Hakushu, the lead character of this biopic.
